intents.name: Do I need to be physically present to open a compa
intents.response: Physical presence is not required to set up a company.

intents.name: Are there any paid-up share capital requirements
intents.response: No paid-up share capital is required.

intents.name: Do shareholders need NOC to incorporate a company
intents.response: NOC is not required to incorporate a company.

intents.response: Yes, you can get a license with a zero-visa at Meydan Free Zone.

intents.name: How many shareholders are allowed
intents.response: A maximum of 100 shareholders are permitted. If more than 6 shareholders, AED 2000 is charged for each additional shareholder.

intents.name: How many directors are allowed
intents.response: A maximum of 4 directors are permitted.

intents.name: How many managers are allowed
intents.response: A maximum of 1 manager is permitted.

intents.name: How many activities are included free of cost
intents.response: You can incorporate the company with 3 groups of activities without any additional charge.
keywords: how many activities are included free of cost

intents.name: What is the cost of adding additional activities
intents.response: The cost of additional activities is AED 1000 per activity. Approvals are required only for regulated activities.

intents.name: Is there a discount for multi-year license applica
intents.response: For multi-year license applications, 2 or more years, there is a standard discount of 15%.

intents.name: Can I be a partner in more than one company
intents.response: Yes, you can be a partner or shareholder in multiple companies.

intents.name: What is the maximum license validity

intents.name: Is there a grace period after the license expires
intents.response: A 30-day grace period is provided from the license expiry date.

intents.name: Is there a penalty if the license is not renewed o

intents.name: Is there a grace period after the immigration card
intents.response: No, there is no grace period provided when the immigration card expires.

intents.name: Is there a penalty if the immigration card expires
intents.response: Yes, the penalty fee is AED 250 per month from the immigration card expiry date.

intents.name: License Package Cost
intents.question: How much does a Meydan Free Zone license cost?
responses: A new corporate license at Meydan Free Zone is AED 12,125. That's an all-in package — it covers your company formation, the trade license itself, one visa allocation, and a flexi desk. You also get 3 business activities included, so you're pretty much set to start operating right away.

The license package is AED 12,125, and honestly it's great value because it bundles everything together — formation, license, visa allocation, and flexi desk, plus 3 business activities. Renewal is the same price. No hidden costs.

It's AED 12,125 for a new license, which includes formation, the license, a visa allocation, and flexi desk — all packaged together. You get up to 3 business activities included in that price. Same cost applies when you renew.

intents.name: License Renewal Cost
intents.question: How much does it cost to renew my license?
responses: License renewal is AED 12,125 — same as a new license. It includes your license, visa allocation, and flexi desk. And here's a nice perk: if you need any amendments done at renewal time, those are completely free.

Renewal is AED 12,125. Same package deal — license, visa allocation, flexi desk, 3 activities. The good news? If you want to make changes like updating your business activities or shareholders, amendments at renewal are free of charge.
It's AED 12,125 to renew, identical to the new license cost. Everything's included — license, visa, flexi desk. Pro tip: time your amendments with your renewal since they're free at that point.

intents.name: What's Included in License Package
intents.question: What's included in the Meydan Free Zone license package?
responses: Your license package includes everything you need to get started: company formation, the trade license, one visa allocation, a flexi desk, and 3 business activities. It's AED 12,125 all-in. You literally just need to submit your documents and you're up and running.

The AED 12,125 package bundles it all — formation of your company, the actual trade license, a visa allocation so you can sponsor employees, a flexi desk for your workspace, and 3 business activities. It's designed so you don't have to pay for things separately.

For AED 12,125 you get: company formation, trade license, one visa allocation, flexi desk access, and 3 business activities included. It's a complete startup package. If you need more activities or visas, those can be added separately.
keywords: what do I get with license

intents.name: License Amendment Cost
intents.question: How much does a license amendment cost?
responses: A license amendment is AED 2,000. But here's a tip — if you time your amendment with your license renewal, it's completely free. So if your renewal is coming up, it's worth waiting a bit to save that 2,000.
It's AED 2,000 for a license amendment. However, if you do it at the same time as your license renewal, there's no charge at all. Same goes if you combine it with formation — AED 0 at renewal time.
License amendments cost AED 2,000. Quick tip though: amendments are free if done during renewal. So unless it's urgent, you might want to bundle it with your next renewal cycle.

intents.name: Additional Business Activity Cost
intents.question: How much does it cost to add more business activities?
responses: Adding an extra business activity is AED 1,000 each. Remember, your license already comes with 3 activities included. So you only pay for the 4th one onwards. Removing or editing an activity is also treated as an amendment at AED 1,000.

It's AED 1,000 per additional business activity. Your standard license includes 3 activities for free, so you'd only need this if you want a 4th, 5th, etc. Just note — even removing an activity counts as an amendment at the same price.

Each additional business activity costs AED 1,000. Since the license already covers 3 activities, most clients don't need extras. But if your business expands into new areas, it's a straightforward AED 1,000 per activity to add.

intents.name: Shareholder Limits and Extra Fees
intents.question: How many shareholders can I have and is there an extra cost?
responses: You can have up to 50 shareholders on your license. The first 6 are included in your standard package at no extra cost. From the 7th shareholder onwards, it's AED 2,000 per additional shareholder. Most small businesses are well within the 6 included.

Up to 50 shareholders are allowed. The first 6 come at no additional charge — you only start paying AED 2,000 per shareholder from number 7 onwards. So for most companies, there's no extra shareholder cost at all.

Meydan allows a maximum of 50 shareholders per license. Six shareholders are included for free. After that, each additional shareholder is AED 2,000. If you're a small team, you're covered without any extra fees.

intents.name: Employment Visa Cost
intents.question: How much does an employment visa cost?
responses: A new employment visa is AED 3,500, and renewal is the same — AED 3,500. Cancellation is AED 800. If you need it processed urgently, there's an additional AED 1,000 urgent service fee. The visa covers your employee's residency in the UAE.

Employment visa is AED 3,500 for new and AED 3,500 for renewal. If you ever need to cancel, that's AED 800. For urgent processing, add AED 1,000 to the base fee. Pretty standard across free zones, and Meydan handles the whole process for you.
It's AED 3,500 for a new employment visa, same for renewal. Cancellation costs AED 800. Need it fast? The urgent service is an extra AED 1,000. This covers the full residence visa for your employee.

intents.name: Investor Partner Visa Cost
intents.question: How much does an investor or partner visa cost?

intents.name: DET Permit for Mainland Operations
intents.question: Can I operate in Dubai mainland with a free zone license?
responses: Yes, you can! You'll need a DET (Department of Economy and Tourism) permit, which costs AED 9,500 through Meydan+. This covers one activity as confirmed by DET. If you need additional activities, each one is AED 5,000. Renewal is also AED 9,500 per year.

Absolutely — with a DET permit you can operate on the mainland. The approval through Meydan+ is AED 9,500, which covers one activity. Additional activities under the DET permit are AED 5,000 each. It's renewed annually at AED 9,500.

You can! Meydan+ helps you get DET approval to operate in Dubai mainland for AED 9,500. That covers one business activity. Need more activities? Each additional one is AED 5,000 on top. The permit renews annually at the same price.

intents.name: Customs Code
intents.question: How do I get a customs code?
responses: A customs code through Meydan+ is AED 525 — same price for new, renewal, or cancellation. You'll need this if your business involves importing or exporting goods. The team handles the registration process for you.
Customs code costs AED 525 whether it's new registration, renewal, or cancellation. It's essential for any import/export activities. Meydan+ takes care of the whole process with Dubai Customs.

Meydan+ handles customs code registration at AED 525. Same price for new, renewal, and cancellation. If you're in the trading business and need to import or export, this is one of the first things you'll want to set up.

intents.name: Company Formation Process
intents.question: How do I start a company with Meydan Free Zone?
responses: Starting a company is pretty straightforward. Company formation itself is free — AED 0. You'll get it packaged with your license at AED 12,125 which covers formation, license, visa allocation, and flexi desk. The process starts with name reservation at AED 500 (valid 30 days), then you submit your documents for pre-approval at AED 500, and once approved, you get your license issued. The whole thing can be done remotely.

It's simple! First, reserve your company name for AED 500 (holds for 30 days). Then apply for pre-approval at AED 500. Once approved, the license package is AED 12,125 which includes formation, license, visa allocation, and flexi desk. Formation itself doesn't cost extra — it's included. You don't even need to be physically present to set everything up.

Great question! Here's how it works: Reserve your trade name (AED 500 for 30 days), get pre-approval (AED 500), then your license package is AED 12,125 all-in — that's formation, license, visa allocation, and flexi desk bundled together. Formation is free when packaged with the license. If you want urgent company setup, there's an express service for AED 1,050. The whole process can be done online.

intents.name: Name Reservation
intents.question: How do I reserve a company name?
responses: Name reservation is AED 500 and it holds your chosen name for 30 days. Renewal is also AED 500 for another 30 days if you need more time. Make sure to check name availability first — the team can help with that.

It costs AED 500 to reserve a company name, valid for 30 days. If you need to extend, you can renew for another AED 500. This ensures nobody else takes your preferred business name while you're preparing your documents.

Company name reservation is AED 500 for a 30-day hold. If you need more time to finalize your setup, you can renew it for another AED 500. I'd recommend having 2-3 name options ready in case your first choice is already taken.

intents.name: License Cancellation
intents.question: How much does it cost to cancel a license?
responses: License cancellation is AED 2,000. This is a one-time fee covering both the license and formation cancellation. Before cancelling, you'll need to make sure all visas are cancelled and any outstanding obligations are settled.

Cancellation is AED 2,000 for both the license and formation together. Keep in mind you'll need to cancel all active visas first and clear any compliance requirements. If your license expired and you're past the 30-day grace period, there's also a AED 500 late fee.

It's AED 2,000 to cancel your license and formation. Just a heads up — you'll need to cancel all employee and partner visas, settle any dues, and handle compliance filings before the license can be fully cancelled.

intents.name: Late Fees and Penalties
intents.question: What are the late fees for renewals?
responses: For license renewal, there's a 30-day grace period after expiry. After that, it's a one-time AED 500 late fee. For the establishment/immigration card, it's AED 250 per month after expiry with no grace period. So definitely try to renew on time to avoid these charges.

Late fees are: AED 500 one-time for license renewal (kicks in after a 30-day grace period post-expiry), and AED 250 per month for establishment card renewal (applies immediately after expiry). Set yourself a reminder a month before each expiry date.

License late renewal fee is AED 500, but you get a 30-day grace period first. Establishment card late fee is AED 250 per month starting right from expiry. My recommendation: renew at least 2 weeks before expiry to avoid any stress.

intents.name: Share Pledge Service
intents.question: What is the share pledge service?
responses: Share pledge is AED 1,000 whether it's new, amendment, or cancellation. It's used when you need to pledge your shares in the company as collateral, usually for bank financing or investment purposes.

A share pledge — new, amend, or cancel — costs AED 1,000 each. This service is typically needed when a shareholder wants to use their company shares as collateral for a loan or as part of an investment agreement.
Share pledge service is AED 1,000 for any action — new pledge, amendment, or cancellation. Companies usually use this when securing bank loans or investment deals where shares serve as security.

intents.name: mElite Service
intents.question: What is mElite?
responses: mElite is Meydan's premium concierge service at AED 3,000 per year for up to 3 stakeholders. Each additional stakeholder is AED 1,000/year. A stakeholder here means any unique investor, partner, director, manager, or employee. It's designed to give you a VIP experience with priority handling.

mElite is your VIP pass at Meydan Free Zone — AED 3,000 per year covering up to 3 stakeholders, with AED 1,000/year for each additional one. Stakeholders include investors, partners, directors, managers, and employees. Think of it as priority service for your most important people.

It's Meydan's premium membership at AED 3,000/year for up to 3 stakeholders. Extra stakeholders are AED 1,000 each per year. A stakeholder is any unique person — investor, partner, director, manager, or employee. Gives you priority handling and VIP treatment across all Meydan services.

intents.name: Bank Account Assistance
intents.question: Can Meydan help me open a bank account?
responses: Yes! Bank account assistance through Meydan+ is AED 1,500. They help facilitate the process with partner banks, prepare the required documentation, and guide you through the application. It significantly improves your chances of getting approved quickly.

Absolutely. Meydan+ offers bank account assistance for AED 1,500. They work with several partner banks and help prepare all your documents to make the process smooth. Having a free zone company sometimes makes it tricky to open bank accounts, so having this assistance is really helpful.

Meydan+ provides bank account opening assistance at AED 1,500. They coordinate with partner banks, prepare your documentation, and guide the whole process. Highly recommended — it makes what can be a frustrating process much smoother.

intents.name: PRO Services
intents.question: What PRO services does Meydan offer?
responses: Meydan+ offers PRO Services Package A at AED 3,000, which gives you 11 hours of support for government-related tasks. They handle things like NOCs from various authorities, customs code registration, employee list processing, MOFA attestation, Dubai Chamber registration, and more. It covers all the government-facing admin work you'd rather not deal with yourself.

The PRO Services Package A is AED 3,000 for 11 hours of support. This covers all government liaison work — NOC applications from authorities like SIRA, RERA, DCAA, TDRA, customs codes, Dubai Chamber registration and document attestation, MOFA attestation, employee lists, and more. Basically everything that requires going to a government office.

PRO services through Meydan+ start at AED 3,000 for Package A which includes 11 hours of government-related support. They handle all the running around — NOCs from 15+ government authorities, customs registration, Dubai Chamber work, MOFA attestation, you name it. Individual services are also available à la carte if you don't need the full package.

intents.name: NOC from Government Authorities
intents.question: How much do NOCs from government authorities cost?
responses: NOC costs depend on the authority. Most are AED 825 — that covers RERA, DMCA, Culture Ministry, Dubai Sport Council, TDRA, MOCCA, KHDA, Dubai Police, and Dubai Municipality. DCAA and SIRA NOCs are AED 1,100. Department of Petroleum (DOPA) is AED 550. RTA NOC is also AED 1,100. Dubai Chamber registration is AED 825.

Here's the breakdown: AED 825 for NOCs from RERA, DMCA, Ministry of Culture & Youth, Dubai Sport Council, TDRA, MOCCA, KHDA, Dubai Police, Dubai Municipality, and Dubai Chamber. Higher at AED 1,100 for DCAA (aviation) and SIRA (security). DOPA is lower at AED 550. RTA is AED 1,100.

Most government authority NOCs through Meydan+ are AED 825 — this covers authorities like RERA, DMCA, KHDA, TDRA, Dubai Police, and several others. Aviation (DCAA) and security (SIRA) NOCs are AED 1,100. Petroleum (DOPA) is AED 550. All of these are NOCs required before your final license can be issued for certain activities.

intents.name: Meydan Commerce E-Commerce Services
intents.question: What e-commerce services does Meydan offer?
responses: Meydan has a full e-commerce suite through Meydan+. The Commerce Starter package is AED 350, with additional product listings at AED 100 per SKU per marketplace. The on-boarding package is AED 6,000 plus AED 2,000 per additional marketplace. For full seller account management, it's AED 24,000 plus AED 12,000 per additional marketplace. There's also an E-Commerce Starter service for getting set up.

Here's the e-commerce lineup: Meydan Commerce Starter at AED 350 gets you started, with AED 100 per additional SKU per marketplace. For full on-boarding support, it's AED 6,000 (plus AED 2,000 per marketplace). If you want them to manage your seller accounts, that's AED 24,000 per year (plus AED 12,000 per marketplace). They basically handle everything from listing to selling.

Meydan+ offers e-commerce services at multiple levels. Starter package is AED 350 to get you set up. On-boarding package at AED 6,000 helps you get onto marketplaces (AED 2,000 per additional marketplace). Full seller account management is AED 24,000 annually with AED 12,000 per additional marketplace. Great for businesses wanting to sell on Amazon, Noon, etc.

intents.name: Digital Business Card Service
intents.question: What is the digital business card service?
responses: The digital business card is a free service included when you form your company. You get a QR code business card with your company logo, name, designation, and contact details. It also comes with a mini website at companyname.fz.mllc.ae, a company email address, and a phone extension where incoming calls are forwarded as voicemail to your email. All valid till end of calendar year.

It's a complimentary service! When you register your company, you get a digital business card with a QR code that stores your contact details. Plus you get a free mini-website at companyname.fz.mllc.ae, a company email ID, and a phone number extension. Calls to the extension are forwarded as voicemail to your email. Pretty neat for AED 0.

Digital business card is free — AED 0. It includes a QR-code based business card with your company logo and contact info, a simple website at companyname.fz.mllc.ae, a company email address (info@companyname.fz.mllc.ae), and a phone extension with voicemail forwarding. It's automatically generated when you register your company.

intents.name: Business Card Starter Package
intents.question: What is the Business Card Starter package?
responses: The Business Card Starter is AED 3,500. This is an upgrade from the free digital card — it gives you professional physical business cards along with enhanced digital presence. It's part of the mCore services suite.
Business Card Starter costs AED 3,500. It's the premium version beyond the free digital business card, giving you a more professional business identity package for your company.

It's AED 3,500 for the Business Card Starter package. This is for clients who want something more polished than the free digital card — better branding, professional design, and physical card options.

intents.name: Long Term Visit Visa
intents.question: Can I get a long-term visit visa through Meydan?
responses: Yes! Meydan+ offers long-term visit visa processing for AED 4,000. This is useful if you need to stay in the UAE for an extended period without a full residence visa.
Meydan+ can arrange a long-term visit visa for AED 4,000. It's a good option if you need to be in the UAE for a longer duration while your company is being set up or for other business purposes.

Long-term visit visa through Meydan+ is AED 4,000. Handy for situations where you need extended UAE stay — like during company setup, business meetings, or while waiting for your residence visa to process.

intents.name: Company Stamp
intents.question: How do I get a company stamp?
responses: A physical company stamp through Meydan+ is AED 200. Simple and quick — they'll make your official company stamp that you can use for signing documents, contracts, and official correspondence.
Company stamp is AED 200 through Meydan+. It's your official rubber stamp with your company name and details. Useful for bank documents, contracts, and any official paperwork.

Meydan+ provides company stamps for AED 200. It's a physical rubber stamp with your company details. While not always mandatory these days, many banks and government entities still ask for a stamped copy of documents.

intents.name: Document Translation
intents.question: Does Meydan offer document translation?
responses: Yes! Legal document translation through Meydan+ is AED 250 per page. This is certified legal translation, typically from English to Arabic or vice versa, which is required for many government submissions.

Meydan+ offers legal document translation at AED 250 per page. It's certified translation, usually English-Arabic, needed for contracts, court documents, government submissions, and legal proceedings.
Legal translation is available at AED 250 per page through Meydan+. It's certified and accepted by all UAE government authorities. Essential for Arabic translations of your corporate documents.

intents.name: Compliance Services
intents.question: What compliance services are available?
responses: Meydan+ offers several compliance services: Compliance Notification Filing at AED 1,300 for portal submissions, Compliance Assessment at AED 1,800 covering ESR, GO AML, and UBO requirements, and ESR Comprehensive Assessment at AED 5,250 for businesses needing a deep dive into financial transactions. These keep you compliant with UAE regulatory requirements.

Here's what's available: Compliance Notification Filing — AED 1,300 (submission on authority portals). Compliance Assessment — AED 1,800 (covers ESR, GO AML, UBO). ESR Comprehensive Assessment — AED 5,250 (deep financial analysis). These are important because UAE has strict compliance requirements and penalties for non-compliance can be significant.

Meydan+ handles all compliance: Notification Filing at AED 1,300 for authority portal submissions, general Compliance Assessment at AED 1,800 for ESR, GO AML, and UBO, and the ESR Comprehensive Assessment at AED 5,250 for detailed financial transaction analysis. Every free zone company needs to stay compliant, so these services are essential.

intents.name: Visa Physical Stamping
intents.question: Do I need to get my visa physically stamped?
responses: No, visa stamping is not mandatory anymore per immigration rules. However, if you'd like a physical stamp on your passport, Meydan can arrange it for AED 1,000. It's completely optional.
Physical visa stamping is optional now — immigration doesn't require it anymore. But if you want the stamp on your passport for peace of mind or any other reason, it's AED 1,000 through Meydan.

Not required! As per current immigration rules, physical visa stamping is no longer mandatory. Your residence visa is digital and valid without a stamp. If you still want one, Meydan offers it as an optional service for AED 1,000.

intents.name: Employee Contract Services
intents.question: How much does an employment contract cost?
responses: Employment contract services are: AED 350 for new, amendment, or renewal. Cancellation is AED 100, but only if you're on a contract or combined with residence visa cancellation. The employment contract is only needed separately if it's not bundled with the visa process.

New employment contract is AED 350, same for amendments and renewals. Cancellation is just AED 100 (only applicable if on contract, otherwise AED 0 when done with residence visa cancellation). This is a separate service only needed when the employment contract isn't part of your standard visa package.

Employment contracts through Meydan are AED 350 each for new, amendment, or renewal. Cancellation is AED 100. These are only applicable when the employment contract is handled separately from the visa process.

intents.name: Change of Status Cost
intents.question: How much does a change of status cost?
responses: Change of status is AED 1,500 for employees. This applies when someone is already in the UAE on a different visa type and needs to switch to an employment or partner visa status without leaving the country.

It's AED 1,500 for a change of status. This is used when a person is currently in the UAE on a visit visa, tourist visa, or another type and needs to change to a residence visa status. Saves you the trip of leaving and re-entering the country.

Status change costs AED 1,500. It's needed when converting from one visa type to another within the UAE — for example, switching from a visit visa to an employment visa. Much more convenient than doing an exit and re-entry.

intents.name: Absconding Case
intents.question: What if an employee absconds?
responses: Filing a new absconding case costs AED 7,500. Cancelling an absconding case is AED 250. This is the legal process you'd need to follow if an employee leaves without proper notice or visa cancellation. It protects you as the employer from liability.

Absconding case filing is AED 7,500 for new cases and AED 250 to cancel. It's an unfortunate situation but necessary to protect your company legally when an employee disappears without going through proper exit procedures.

For absconding cases: filing is AED 7,500, cancellation is AED 250. It's the formal process to report an employee who has abandoned their position. Important to file this to avoid any immigration liability on your company.

intents.name: Meydan Pay Service
intents.question: What is Meydan Pay?
responses: Meydan Pay is a free payment service — AED 0. It's available to all Meydan Free Zone companies and helps facilitate payments. For Channel Partner clients, it's also offered free of charge.
Meydan Pay is a complimentary service — absolutely free. It's a payment facilitation tool for Meydan Free Zone companies. If you're a Channel Partner (CP) client, you also get it at no cost.
It's free! Meydan Pay costs AED 0 and is available to all Meydan Free Zone companies. Channel Partner clients also get it for free. It's designed to make your payment processes smoother.

intents.name: Refund Processing Fee
intents.question: Is there a refund processing fee?
responses: Yes, there's a AED 2,000 admin fee when processing refunds for rejected Establishment Card or Partner Visa applications. This is the processing charge for handling the refund back to you.
Refund processing fee is AED 2,000. This applies when you need a refund for a rejected establishment card or partner visa application. It covers the administrative costs of processing the refund.

There's a AED 2,000 refund processing fee, which kicks in when an establishment card or partner visa application gets rejected and you need your money back. It's an admin charge for processing the refund.

intents.name: Return Permit for Residents Abroad
intents.question: What if I've been outside the UAE for more than 6 months?
responses: If you've been outside the UAE for more than 6 months, you'll need a Return Permit to re-enter. Meydan+ handles this for AED 850. Without it, your residence visa might be at risk of cancellation due to extended absence.

Meydan+ offers a Return Permit for AED 850 for residents who've been outside the UAE for more than 6 months. This is important because your residence visa can be affected if you stay away too long. The permit ensures you can re-enter without issues.

You'll need a Return Permit — AED 850 through Meydan+. Being outside the UAE for over 6 months can jeopardize your residence visa status. This permit ensures you can return and your visa stays active.

intents.name: Mail Management Service
intents.question: What is the mail management service?
responses: Mail management through Meydan+ is AED 750 per year for both new and renewal. Cancellation is free. The team receives, sorts, and manages your physical mail on your behalf. Great if you don't have a physical office presence.

Meydan+ mail management costs AED 750/year. They handle receiving and organizing all your company mail. New setup and renewal are the same price, and cancellation is AED 0. It pairs well with the PO Box service.

It's AED 750 per year. Meydan+ receives and manages your postal mail for you. Super useful if you're running your business remotely or don't have a physical office. Cancellation is free whenever you want.

intents.name: Document Pick Up and Drop Off
intents.question: Can Meydan pick up or deliver documents for me?
responses: Yes! Meydan+ offers document pick-up and drop-off services within Dubai. Pick-up is AED 250, drop-off is AED 250, or you can get both together for AED 500. Very handy when you can't make it to the office.

Absolutely. Document pick-up is AED 250 and drop-off is AED 250 — both within Dubai. If you need a combined pick-up and drop-off, it's AED 500. Saves you the trip when you need to submit or collect documents.
Meydan+ does document pick-up for AED 250 and drop-off for AED 250, all within Dubai. Combined service is AED 500. Really useful if you're busy or not near the Meydan office.

intents.name: Overstay Fine Settlement
intents.question: What about overstay fines?
responses: Overstay fine settlement fee through Meydan is AED 250 — that's their processing fee to handle the settlement. The actual overstay fine amount depends on how long the overstay period is, as per UAE immigration rules.
The processing fee for overstay fine settlement is AED 250 through Meydan. This is separate from the actual government overstay fine, which varies based on the number of days overstayed.

Meydan charges AED 250 as a settlement processing fee for overstay fines. The government fine itself is separate and depends on how many days the person overstayed. Best to resolve it quickly as fines accumulate daily.

intents.name: Total Startup Cost Estimate
intents.question: What's the total cost to set up a company in Meydan Free Zone?
responses: For a basic setup, here's what you're looking at: License package AED 12,125 (includes formation, license, visa allocation, flexi desk). Then you'll need your visa — employment visa AED 3,500 or investor visa AED 4,000. Add medical and Emirates ID at AED 2,250. So roughly AED 17,875 to AED 18,375 to be fully set up and operational. Name reservation and pre-approval add AED 1,000 upfront.

Ballpark for a basic setup: License package is AED 12,125 all-in. Visa is AED 3,500 (employee) or AED 4,000 (investor/partner). Medical + EID is AED 2,250. So you're looking at about AED 18,000-19,000 total to get your company running with one person. Optional add-ons like PO Box, phone answering, and medical insurance are extra.

A typical startup costs roughly AED 18,000-19,000. That breaks down to: AED 12,125 for the license package (formation + license + visa allocation + flexi desk), AED 3,500-4,000 for your visa, and AED 2,250 for medical and EID. Plus AED 500 for name reservation and AED 500 for pre-approval. Everything else — office upgrades, PO Box, phone answering — is optional depending on your needs.

intents.name: Urgent Services
intents.question: Are there urgent or express processing options?
responses: Yes! Urgent company setup is AED 1,050 for expedited processing. Urgent employee service (for visa new/renew/cancel) is AED 1,000 extra. Urgent Emirates ID with biometrics appointment is AED 1,250, or AED 2,750 combined with medical assistance. These get your requests prioritized and processed faster.

Meydan offers several express options: Urgent company setup at AED 1,050, urgent visa processing at AED 1,000 extra (covers new, renewal, or cancellation), and urgent Emirates ID at AED 1,250 (with biometrics appointment included). If you need medical + urgent EID, that's AED 2,750. Worth it when time is critical.

Express processing is available for most services. Company setup can be expedited for AED 1,050. Visa processing urgency is an extra AED 1,000. Urgent EID processing with biometrics is AED 1,250 or AED 2,750 with medical. If you're in a rush, these services are lifesavers.

intents.name: All Prices VAT Inclusive
intents.question: Are the prices inclusive of VAT?
responses: Yes, all prices quoted by Meydan Free Zone are in AED and inclusive of VAT where applicable. What you see is what you pay — no hidden taxes on top.
All prices are quoted in AED and include VAT where applicable. So the amounts I've shared are the final amounts — no additional tax surprises.
Everything is VAT inclusive where applicable. All pricing is in AED. The price you're quoted is the price you pay. Straightforward, no hidden charges.

intents.name: Innovation and Knowledge Fees
intents.question: What are the Innovation and Knowledge fees?
responses: Innovation Fee and Knowledge Fee are each AED 10, charged once per invoice. They're standard government-mandated fees that appear on your invoices. Very small amounts — just AED 20 total per invoice.
These are small government fees — AED 10 each (Innovation Fee + Knowledge Fee = AED 20 total), charged once per invoice. They're standard across Dubai free zones.
They're AED 10 each per invoice — Innovation Fee and Knowledge Fee. So AED 20 combined. Standard government-mandated charges that show up on every invoice. Nothing major.

intents.name: NOC to Lease Outside Free Zone
intents.question: Can I lease an office outside the free zone?
responses: Yes! You'll need a NOC (No Objection Certificate) to lease a facility outside the Meydan Free Zone, which costs AED 2,500. This allows your free zone company to rent office or warehouse space on the mainland or in other areas.

You can! Meydan issues a NOC for leasing facilities outside the free zone at AED 2,500. This is needed if you want to rent a warehouse, shop, or office elsewhere in Dubai while keeping your Meydan Free Zone license.

Absolutely. The NOC to Lease Facility Outside the Free Zone is AED 2,500. Many companies use this to get additional workspace or storage on the mainland while maintaining their free zone company structure.

intents.name: Corporate Letters and Resolutions
intents.question: How much do corporate letters and resolutions cost?
responses: Corporate letter is AED 250, employee letter is also AED 250, and a resolution is AED 350. Certified true copy is AED 350. These are standard administrative documents you might need for banks, embassies, or other official purposes.

Corporate letters are AED 250 each, employee letters AED 250, board resolutions AED 350, and certified true copies AED 350. Pretty standard pricing for the admin paperwork that comes with running a business.

Here's the admin document pricing: Corporate letter — AED 250, employee letter — AED 250, resolution — AED 350, certified true copy — AED 350. You'll typically need these for bank account openings, visa applications, or legal matters.
